com.idibon.api.model

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.idibon.api.model.IdibonHash
      • com.idibon.api.model.Task

  • public class Task
extends IdibonHash
    A machine learning task inside a Collection. Tasks contain Labels that represent specific extraction or classification operations, and Features that convert document content and metadata into machine learning features.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Task.Keys
      Keys that may be present in a Task JSON.
      static class  Task.Scope
      All tasks have a scope, which defines the type of predictive analytics that the task will be annotated and trained to perform.

    • Method Detail

      • classifications

        public DocumentPrediction classifications(DocumentContent doc)
                                   throws IOException
        Classifies a single document. This is the same as calling classifications(Arrays.asList(doc)), accessing the first (and only) element returned from the iterable, and either throwing the exception on error or returning the prediction object on success.
        Parameters:
        doc - A DocumentContent to predict.
        Returns:
        The SpanPrediction result.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • classifications

        public PredictionIterable<DocumentPrediction> classifications(Iterable<? extends DocumentContent> items)
                                                       throws IOException
        Calls the prediction API to classify the list of documents according to the Label defined for this Task.
        Parameters:
        items - Items to predict
        Returns:
        A PredictionIterable that can be adjusted to return extra information for each prediction (such as significant features), and which lazily classifies all of the listed documents.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • spans

        public SpanPrediction spans(DocumentContent doc)
                     throws IOException
        Extracts spans from a single document. This is the same as calling spans(Arrays.asList(doc)), accessing the first (and only) element returned from the iterable, and either throwing the exception on error or returning the prediction object on success.
        Parameters:
        doc - A DocumentContent to predict.
        Returns:
        The SpanPrediction result.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • spans

        public PredictionIterable<SpanPrediction> spans(Iterable<? extends DocumentContent> items)
                                         throws IOException
        Calls the prediction API to extract spans for a list of documents against this Task.
        Parameters:
        items - The DocumentContent instances to predict.
        Returns:
        A PredictionIterable that can be adjusted to return extra information for each prediction, and which lazily extracts spans on all of the listed documents.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • modify

        public TaskBuilder modify()
        Creates a TaskBuilder instance to modify properties of this Task. You must call TaskBuilder.commit() on the returned object to save the modifications to the API.
        Returns:
        TaskBuilder modifying this Task.

      • delete

        public void delete()
            throws IOException
        Deletes this task, and removes all references to it from the ontology.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • createLabel

        public LabelBuilder createLabel(String name)
        Creates a LabelBuilder instance to define a new Label for this Task. You must call LabelBuilder.commit() on the returned object to save the new label to the API.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the new label to create. Must be unique.
        Returns:
        A LabelBuilder to configure additional properties of the new label.

      • addRules

        public void addRules(TuningRules.Rule... rules)
              throws IOException
        Adds new tuning rules to the task, or update the weights for existing rules. Modification of tuning rules is not idempotent, so this method is designed to prevent concurrent actions that could result in non- deterministic results. If multiple Task instances are created for the same API task, the application must take care to ensure that all calls to addRules(com.idibon.api.model.TuningRules.Rule...) and deleteRules(com.idibon.api.model.TuningRules.Rule...) are serialized to ensure consistent results.
        Parameters:
        rules - List of rules to add. If an identical rule already exists in the task, the rules' weight will be updated to the new value.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • deleteRules

        public void deleteRules(TuningRules.Rule... rules)
                 throws IOException
        Deletes one or more existing tuning rules. Modification of tuning rules is not idempotent, so this method is designed to prevent concurrent actions that could result in non- deterministic results. If multiple Task instances are created for the same API task, the application must take care to ensure that all calls to addRules(com.idibon.api.model.TuningRules.Rule...) and deleteRules(com.idibon.api.model.TuningRules.Rule...) are serialized to ensure consistent results.
        Parameters:
        rules - Array of tuning rules to delete from this task's tuning dictionary. All of the rules must be for labels within this task.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • isDescendent

        public boolean isDescendent(Task check)
                     throws IOException
        Returns true if child is an ontological descendent of this task.
        Parameters:
        check - A Task to test.
        Returns:
        true if child is located within the ontology rooted at the current node. false if not.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getSubtasks

        public Map<Label,Set<? extends Task>> getSubtasks()
                                           throws IOException
        Returns the list of sub-tasks that are triggered by predictions for each Label in this task.
        Returns:
        Map of labels to subtasks
        Throws:
        IOException

      • addSubtaskTriggers

        public void addSubtaskTriggers(Label trigger,
                               Task... tasks)
                        throws IOException
        Configures a subtask trigger: when a document is classified as the provided Label, the document should also be classified against the triggered Task.
        Parameters:
        trigger - The Label in this task that will trigger the subtasks.
        tasks - The new Task instances that should be triggered by label.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • deleteSubtaskTriggers

        public void deleteSubtaskTriggers(Label trigger,
                                  Task... tasks)
                           throws IOException
        Deletes a subtask trigger.
        Parameters:
        trigger - The Label in this task that triggers the subtasks.
        tasks - The new Task instances that should not be triggered by label.
        Throws:
        IOException
